messages.content: How do I install the ComfyUI-BiRefNet-Hugo custom node?
You need to: 1) Enter the node directory `ComfyUI/custom_nodes/`; 2) Perform a `git clone` of the repository; 3) Navigate to the cloned directory; 4) Run `pip install -r requirements.txt`.
What are the usage instructions for the ComfyUI-BiRefNet-Hugo workflow?
The demo workflow is placed in the `ComfyUI-BiRefNet-Hugo/workflow` folder. Instructions might differ from the image segmentation process of the BiRefNet model.
What are the different functionalities supported by the BiRefNet model?
BiRefNet supports background-removal, mask-generation, Dichotomous Image Segmentation, Camouflaged Object Detection, and Salient Object Detection.
How does Dichotomous Image Segmentation distinguish between foreground and background?
Dichotomous Image Segmentation (DIS) predicts a dichotomy between a foreground object and its background scene, effectively dividing an image into two categories.
Who is the repository owner of BiRefNet?
The repository is owned by ZhengPeng7, available on GitHub at [ZhengPeng7/BiRefNet](https://github.com/zhengpeng7/birefnet).
What does the `workflow.json` in ComfyUI-BiRefNet-Hugo do?
The `workflow.json` file is used to define the workflow for generating output images from input images and segmentation masks.
Compute the model's confidence score on an input image?
This functionality is not directly mentioned in the document, but custom nodes can be developed to implement such features.
